Steve Hart’s family given temporary reprieve after Thames Coromandel District Council threatened to bulldoze house https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/steve-harts-family-given-temporary-reprieve-after-thames-coromandel-district-council-threatened-to-bulldoze-house/TZJGT36JPVHCBAMR2WHQJUTRRQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/steve-harts-family-given-temporary-reprieve-after-thames-coromandel-district-council-threatened-to-bulldoze-house/TZJGT36JPVHCBAMR2WHQJUTRRQ/ Earlier, Steve Hart, his wife and his four daughters had until Monday to leave the house. Customs shares list of ‘strange, sophisticated’ new ways drugs are being smuggled into New Zealand https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/customs-shares-list-of-strange-sophisticated-new-ways-drugs-are-being-smuggled-into-new-zealand/7APIB6B7CBCA5JG6QJZONE3L7I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/customs-shares-list-of-strange-sophisticated-new-ways-drugs-are-being-smuggled-into-new-zealand/7APIB6B7CBCA5JG6QJZONE3L7I/ Jaime LythCustoms say concealment methods by drug traffickers are increasing in sophistication. Fri, 15 Nov 2024 17:31:49 +0000 Items used to conceal drugs at the border include a diamante-encrusted horse head (cocaine), children's toys (MDMA), hair products (cocaine), lollies (methamphetamine) - and a methamphetamine crystal seized by authorities. Composite photo / NZ Customs and Police

Sand mining fears for Northland’s Bream Bay rise as project approved for fast-track consenting https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/sand-mining-fears-rise-as-fast-track-consent-approved-for-northlands-bream-bay/NT3W57A56NDKJMYXR7YFCCLDO4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/sand-mining-fears-rise-as-fast-track-consent-approved-for-northlands-bream-bay/NT3W57A56NDKJMYXR7YFCCLDO4/ Denise PiperThe fast-track process may hand 'the keys to the coastline' to the sand miner, some fear. Sand extraction opponents fear the Bream Bay proposal will stop the sand on the beach being replenished, making erosion worse. Photo / Michael Cunningham
